result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victim A/U-Haul Store listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

8:36 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Charles G Ambah in court.  Attorney Gregory Kotsonis in court for Charles G Ambah. 

The Court recesses at 08:39 AM for counsel and defendant to speak off the record.
The Court recalls the matter at 08:47 AM with the same appearance.

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
